poem:
**At the Heart**  

In the churning halls  
where words spin—  
a call for peace,  
quiet as winter wheat.  

Two leaders, voices  
crossing seas,  
dance a delicate thread.  

Ukraine—a whispered  
root in earth,  
must stand at  
the heart,  
where silence beckons  
dove's flight,  
amidst the clamor  
of demanding skies.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Keir Starmer lays down Ukraine peace demand ahead of Trump talks Keir Starmer has raised the stakes before a crucial meeting in Washington with the US president, Donald Trump this week, by insisting that Ukraine must be “at the heart of any negotiations” on a peace deal with Russia. The prime minister made the remarks – which run directly contrary to comments by the US president last week – in a phone call on Saturdaywith". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
